title: Reece Hodge
text:
Reece Hodge (born 26 August 1994) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for the <a href="Melbourne%20Rebels">Melbourne Rebels</a> in <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a>. A utility back, Hodge can play fly-half, outside centre, wing or fullback. Hodge completed his secondary Education at <a href="Manly%20Selective%20Campus">Manly Selective Campus</a>, along with fellow Super Rugby player, <a href="Cadeyrn%20Neville">Cadeyrn Neville</a>.
Career.
Reece played his junior rugby with the Harbord Harlequins’s and then later with the Manly Marlins. He made his debut for the Rebels scoring two tries, 2 conversions and 2 penalties totalling 20 points.
Hodge signed a contract with the Melbourne Rebels in 2016.
In Mid-2016, Hodge was called up to replace <a href="Mike%20Harris%20%28rugby%20union%29">Mike Harris</a> in the <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wallabies</a> squad for the 2016 series against England.
In the opening test of the 2020 <a href="Bledisloe%20Cup">Bledisloe Cup</a>, Hodge had a 55 metre penalty goal attempt to win the match that hit the post. The match ended in a 16-all draw.
